item.title: Climate Action Plan 2.0
item.description: Eugene’s Community Climate Action Plan 2.0 (CAP2.0) continues the momentum created by Eugene’s Climate Recovery Ordinance by identifying research-based actions that will help the community reach its climate goals most quickly.

item.description: The City of Eugene's Public Works department is responsible for maintaining city streets and responding to tree hazards following weather events.

item.title: Eugene Sunday Streets
item.description: Eugene Sunday Streets events promote healthy, active living by opening the city’s largest public space—its streets —for people to walk, bike and roll in a safe, car-free environment.

item.description: Come join us for our annual open house where you can learn about all of the ways we work to make lives better through the services we provide each day!

item.title: Single-Use Ordinances
item.description: Single-use items such as straws, utensils, stirrers, condiment packaging, bags, and polystyrene food and beverage containers present problems for environmental and human health when they become litter. Acknowledging these problems, City Council passed ordinances in 2019 that places restrictions on these items.

item.title: Ground Transportation Operations
item.description: Any Person, and or company, conducting a commercial ground transportation function originating at the Eugene Airport must have authorization for such activities under terms of a lease, contract or permit with the City of Eugene and the Eugene Airport. Such operations are limited to parking locations and procedures as set forth in these regulations and specific written agreements with the Eugene Airport and are subject to change.
